data.title: Yummy Southern Brunch with Music!
data.text: This place is great, particularly for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday. Be prepared to wait in line or sit at the bar. I had the shrimp and grits which was lemony and light, a great cure for a hangover.

data.title: Weekend visit with friends
data.text:
Great local restaurant. Very quick and friendly service. Busy Friday night but were seated fairly quickly. 
The fresh bread was delicious.  One person ordered the goat stew which was very good. The meatloaf had a spicy gravy with curry. Reuben sandwich was big and yummy. The short ribs were very tender. Great selection of tasty food and generous portions! We'll be back.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: We ate here while on vacation.   A fun place with a good atmosphere.  Food was good and the beer selection was quite good as well.   Easy to get to from our hotel in Somerville.

data.title: Elevated casual
data.text:
I have been meaning to eat at Highland Kitchen for ages, and finally got there today.  The vibe is friendly and casual, but the creative menu takes things to a new level.  There were so many tempting dishes that we didn't know where to start.  Our server gave some great suggestions, so we began with some house-favorite cocktails.  For starters we chose the Buffalo Brussels Sprouts and the Baby Octopus --  I would order both again, right now if possible.   The chef's specialty is a spicy curry goat stew, so of course I had to try that. It was loaded with flavor and seasonal veggies, the goat tender and delectable.  My daughter had steak which was cooked perfectly rare as requested; the Chinese broccoli that accompanied it was delicious as well.  

Sometimes a great restaurant is as much a result of the atmosphere as the food, and Highland Kitchen was impeccable on both levels.

data.title: This Place Rocks
data.text:
Our local tour guides suggested the Highland for dinner but warned us that we were going to wait at least an hour for a table on a Saturday night, even at 6pm. Much to their surprise we got a table immediately even though there was a big crowd in the bar.

We started with drinks and apps. The buffalo Brussels sprouts were one of the better preps of this veggie I have had. The grilled octopus was also very good. Our drinks were less successful - we did not care for their take on the Singapore Sling and the Mai Tai. Perhaps they were going for a less sweet formulation...

All of the entrees were large portions and very good from the jambalaya with good spice to the Cuban sandwich. The goat and the cod special were also very good.  Despite the packed house the service was very attentive. 

We can see why our friends love this place.

data.title: Overrated
data.text: I find this restaurant a bit overrated. I had to wait for one hour before being seated and the food was average. There are plenty of other options in the area.

data.title: A very lively birthday dinner!
data.text:
The food was excellent.  The service was outstanding.  Need we say more, yes!  This was a birthday celebration and we had a group of six.  We did arrive on the earlier side of dinner so we did not wait very long to be seated.  It is very loud and lively in the restaurant and the seating is a little compact, but was an enjoyable dinner.
The spicy coconut spiced goat stew which the they raved about, no leftovers here!  Two went for the pan roasted chicken, which was so delicious!  Summer ratatouille with polenta--a hit!  Some of us did find our appetizers to be on the salty side, but they were cooked perfectly.  Enjoyed delicious desserts and cocktails as well.  Can't wait to return.

data.title: Soooooooo Good!
data.text: Reviews said this was a great bar. We wanted dinner and tried it anyway. It might be a good bar, but the food was amazing! It is a loud and lively place and we had a 30-45 minute wait. But, we only waited about 20 minutes. We started with goat cheese fritters that were to die for. True greatness. I had the pan roasted boneless chicken with sweet potato hash and broccolini. My son had the fish and chips with cole slaw. Both of our meals were great, really great. I had an entire 1/2 of a chicken! The gravy was really good, not overly seasoned. It allowed the chicken flavor to be the star and I appreciated that. The fish was battered well and wasn't greasy. And the portion was very large! For dessert we had an ice cream trio (triple chocolate, vanilla and strawberry - yummy!) and banana bread bread pudding that was very, very good.  The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive without being over bearing.  The only negative is the place needs to be 2-3 times the size that it is!

data.title: First-time visitor!!
data.text: The food was superb!!  Appetizer we had was friend soft-shell crab: it was perfect!!  Beer selection:  waitress allowed us to sample two beers: we chose a fruity smooth one (forgot the name).  We had Spicy Jambalaya: excellent. and English Style Beer Battered Fish & Chips: excellent!! Waitress was attentive and knowledgeable.  Will recommend and return here often.

data.title: Great food excellent service budget friendly
data.text: I want to tell everyone this place is wonderful and I don't want to tell anyone about it at all! It's already crowded. It is a lively busy place for dinner and (I see) for drinks too. The food is excellent quality, far above other local mid-priced restaurants, and they have steak, pasta, fish, real mashed potatoes and strict vegetarian items as well. Warning if u rely on the picture that comes up when you google Highland Kitchen u will think u are in the wrong place. Yes, it would be nice if it was brighter and more open. It's an old style restaurant bar so it's dark at dinner time and it gets quite crowded any day of the week. There's a reason for that! Enjoy!

data.title: Bloody Mary's are a MUST!
data.text: I LOVE highland kitchen! This place is a must for brunch on Sunday's. You have to get here early if you don't want to wait long for a table and I mean before they open! There is usually a line waiting around the corner for a table. Their Bloody Mary mix is to die for and the pickled green beans are such a great addition that I had to make my own at home. Their mix has the perfect amount of spice, and heat and flavor. Yummy!!! The fried green tomatoes and the deviled eggs are delicious as a starter, and I absolutely love the dirty bird as an entree. The fried chicken is so good with the gravy and biscuits. Definitely a must if you haven't been here before!

data.title: Great but noisy
data.text: 5* if not for the noise and the small bar. The food was really good as we're the drinks. They should buy out the convenience store and expand.

data.title: Highland Kitchen hits a home run
data.text:
We were a foursome including one gluten free person in our party on a Monday night. The restaurant was packed by 7:30. Our bartender was warm and accommodating filling our glasses with fresh draft beers even with a full bar full of people, which left me impressed and feeling very welcomed. It's a lively place and as others have mentioned a bit loud at times and could use some dampening for sure, but have another brew and the noise gets softer. 

We sampled four apps to start; fried green tomatoes (excellent), Jerk wings (decent but not that special), Deviled eggs (fantastic) and the gordita with braised pork (again, excellent). 

Our mains were two of the most amazing orders of Spicy Coconut Curried Goat Stew 
with jasmine rice & fried sweet plantains. I can't say enough about this dish. It just has it all. Heat, sweet and complexity married with sweet, brasied-to-perfection goat. Just order it if you love Caribbean food and you'll be in goat stew heaven. A show stopper. 

The sloppy Joe could have used more sloppy for sure but was delicious despite being a bit stingy on the chili. 

The fried chicken though not the top of the alter of fried chicken (this is Southern food after all) was very tasty, just maybe not the best you'll ever have. 

We finished with a shared order of bourbon banana bread pudding and vanilla ice cream that was the bomb. 

Our server was perfectly on point and made us all feel happy to be there. The vibe is happy, boisterous at times and it just feels good to be there. The menu has a Southern focus with an eclectic world sensibility. I can't imagine ordering anything here you'd regret ordering. It's that good. 

I will be back for that goat stew.

data.title: Great Blue fish cakes and other delicious foods
data.text: Love the Bluefish cakes and pretty much every dish I've eaten there over the years. Gourmet food but a bar ish atmosphere . Hipster. Fun loud.

data.title: Best neighborhood restaurant
data.text: Oh, this place! The food is so tasty and wholesome. Staff is really nice and always sociable. Wish going out were more in my budget; I'd go here almost every night!

data.title: Fun food, inventive drinks, a little loud
data.text:
Every Monday night - Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Tiki Drinks - that about sums up this place.

Inventive drinks (most in the $10-$15 range) and good, if a little uneven food.

The fried chicken is great and the kitchen cranks it out fast and piping hot. Biscuits and wilted greens, yummy mashed potatoes - a home run.

The pulled pork sandwich on another trip was soaked in vinegar sauce (ask for it on the side) and the meat was a little dry - especially the burnt ends. Did have a choice of green salad or fries. Chose the salad. I usually ask for dressing on the side and should have this time. Came in a pool of house dressing (oil, loads of vinegar, and spices). The dressing was tasty, but pooled on the plate, even soaking the bun for the pulled pork sandwich.

Now I will address the loud factor. Not the place for an intimate conversation, but bring the friends and the kids. Some people would call it lively. I would like it if it was just a bit quieter.

Friendly staff that pitches in for each other's tables. Bar can get VERY crowded - popular hang out spot.

Overall good - a neighborhood joint.

data.title: Funky, fun and fabulous!
data.text: We walked in on a weeknight, and the place was hopping.  The crowd was a lively, eclectic mix of folks - all ages and personalities were on display.  We gave our name to the hostess and ambled up to the bar.  Before we had a chance to order drinks, they had found a table for us much more quickly than we had expected.  We each ordered a drink - he the "beer of the moment", a Gose ale.  I had a specialty bourbon drink that was awesome.  We both had seconds!  The menu was filled with all sorts of interesting and creative takes on a wide variety of comfort food.  I settled on the spicy goat stew, for which they are deservedly well known.  Not a drop was left when I finished.  My companion had the fish & chips.  The fish was crispy on the outside, most and flaky on the inside.  The fries were done to perfection.  Though we didn't have room for it, we shared a bread pudding.  It may have been the best bread pudding that either of us had ever had.  Not sure how I had missed this spot before, but I will DEFINITELY be back!

data.title: Brunch!
data.text: Ate here for brunch last April and have been numerous times for dinner. Great southern style food. Great atmosphere too. Prices reasonable too. Get here early as brunch lines get long after 10am. Worth a try in Somerville among the many places.

data.title: Best Darn food in Summerville Ma.
data.text: My son took us to this restaurant.  The Highland Kitchen, don't forget the name. Upbeat millennials, lots of young families, busy bar, packed to capacity, not an empty table. Got seated pretty quickly.  Food is the best!  I ordered the Goat Curry with Fried Plantains, try it, go outside your comfort zone, best eating I have had in a long time.  Would go back to MA. just to eat he again.

data.title: Everything is delicious!
data.text: One of my favorite, favorite places to eat...or drink! Try their pan roasted half chicken and a Whiskey Smash!
